posts.name: Layton
posts.cooked:
What drive bases are teams thinking about?

we are personally going with Swerve

posts.name: Joyful blessings
posts.cooked: Absolutely swerve. Our team just made a new one this year

posts.name: Marcus
posts.cooked: If your team has the capability to do swerve, swerve is for sure the best option.

posts.name: Joyful blessings
posts.cooked: If you are nor capable to do swerve, for this game i would suggest tank drive

posts.name: R.C.
posts.cooked:
For teams just getting started with swerve, West Coast Products ( WCP ), Cross the Road Electronics (CTR), and FIRST in Michigan ( FIM ) have partnered to create a step-by-step resource. In addition, we are offering approximately 15% off a complete swerve kit, including some electronics.

The FIRST in Michigan (FIM) Swerve X2i Bundle brings together top-of-the-line components from WCP and CTR Electronics, providing everything you need to build a powerful, reliable swerve drive system. This kit is specifically designed to complement...

Price: USD 1,729.99

https://firstinmichigan.us/ FRC /frc-swerve-drive-build-series/

link_counts.title: FIM Swerve X2i Bundle – WestCoast Products
FRC Swerve Drive Build Series – FRC

posts.name: Marshall tveit
posts.cooked: With how open it is swerve is definitely the clear choice. If that is not a option tank is the next beat thing beacuse there is little to maneuver around so you can really open up tank this year.
The moral of the story is don’t use Mecanum!

posts.name: Miles.D
posts.cooked: with i would agree but with the limited defense this year i could see more teams going back to mecanum drive if they can’t afford serve but still want to play hyper offense.

posts.name: Geoffrey
posts.cooked: Swerve but we might change to a larger gear ratio since we tested with the 5.12 and it’s nowhere near the top speed during the cycle.

posts.name: John Burdick
posts.cooked: Swerve drive. Since defense will be tough for this game, teams have to rely on fast cycles between coral substations and the Reef to secure a win. That, and it would make traversing through the barge area slightly easier.

posts.name: Owen
posts.cooked: Our team doesn’t have swerve, so we are probably going to use a modified H drive or a tank drive with a way to strafe for alignment with the reef, should be interesting regardless

posts.name: Theo Schrader
posts.cooked: Is anyone running this kit? Iam planning on buying it once its back in stock. We are a 2nd year team and went with Mech… should have just went swerve, it been such a pain and no one uses it anymore so it hard to get help at comps.

suggested_topics.title: Need HID Controller for gaming
suggested_topics.excerpt: Need PCB for gaming controller and calibration software for it. If anyone can make that for me please contact me.

suggested_topics.title: Swerve X covers
suggested_topics.excerpt: Does anyone have models for Swerve X covers? We want one for Swerve X Flipped, not X2. My team can design our own but I’d prefer just to get them off here to save some time.
